intro: Scabiosa leucantha, commonly known as the white scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in meadows and grasslands. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to gardens and natural habitats.
